intro: Ditta maestrensis, commonly known as the royal spire plant, is a striking member of the Acanthaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems that can grow up to 3 meters in height, adorned with lance-shaped leaves that are a deep, glossy green. The plant produces clusters of vibrant red and purple tubular flowers, which bloom in summer and attract pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. Ditta maestrensis thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained, fertile soil. It is native to the tropical regions of South America and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
